text:
Manchester is a city in Dickinson County, Kansas, United States. As of the 2010 census, 95 people lived there.
History.
In 1887, Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe Railway built a railroad from Neva (3 miles west of Strong City) through Manchester to Superior, Nebraska. In 1996, the Atchison, Topeka and Santa Fe Railway merged with Burlington Northern Railroad and renamed to the current BNSF Railway. Most people still call this railroad the "Santa Fe".
Manchester was first called Keystone, and was planned out in 1887. The name Manchester was adopted by 1890.
The post office in Manchester was closed in 1993.
Geography.
According to the United States Census Bureau says that the city has a total area of. All of it is land.
2010 census.
As of the 2010 census says that there were 95 people, 38 households, and 24 families living in the city.
Education.
Manchester is a part of USD 473 Chapman. The Chapman High School mascot is Chapman Fighting Irish.
